alert.note: Alert for Colfax; Mora; Rio Arriba; Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 12 at 6:23PM MST until December 12 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Taos County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Northwestern Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... Northwestern Colfax County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 622 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Arroyo Hondo to near Velarde, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 358 and 374. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 229 and 288. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 34 and 36. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 47 and 72. Locations impacted include... Espanola, Taos, Questa, Angel Fire, Red River, Eagle Nest, Taos Ski Valley, Taos Pueblo, Embudo and Penasco. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and turn on headlights! The visibility will suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
